title: Understanding Analysis Types
text: In analytical chemistry, we often categorize analyses into different types based on what we are measuring or identifying. Consider what you are trying to determine about the glucose in the blood.

title: Quantitative vs. Qualitative Analysis
text: Quantitative analysis involves measuring the amount or concentration of a substance, while qualitative analysis involves identifying the presence or absence of a substance. Which one applies to measuring glucose concentration?

title: Choosing the Correct Analysis Type
text: Given the options: qualitative, quantitative, characterization, and fundamental, which one best describes the analysis of measuring glucose concentration in blood?
